definition: an abrupt, sharp, jerky blow or movement
a sudden feeling of shock, surprise, or disappointment, an event or development causing such a feeling
examples: the news gave them a jolt
the defeat was quite a jolt

definition: a small but potent or bracing portion of something
to disturb the composure of : shock
examples: crudely jolted out of that mood
an announcement that jolted the community

definition: to interfere with roughly, abruptly, and disconcertingly
examples: determination to pursue his own course was jolted badly

definition: to cause to move with a sudden jerky motion
examples: passengers being jolted along a bumpy road

definition: to give a knock or blow to, to jar with a quick or hard blow
to move with a sudden jerky motion
